newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan interbank rate ends stable, seen firmer.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan interbank rate ends stable, seen firmer.

text.p: Taiwan's interbank rate closed stable on Friday after the central bank injected T$22 billion in postal funds to ease tight liquidity, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate finished at 5.491 percent against Thursday's 5.495 close, with 30-day commercial paper stable at 5.50 percent.
Dealers said liquidity demand for the lunar Chinese New Year and the planned auction of T$40 billion in government bonds would tighten liquidity in the banking system.
Sentiment was slow in the bond market. No trade was reported in the afternoon. -- Rachel Lee (5080815)
